Class Card

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.Cards.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Card_AbandonedShip, Card_AbandonedStation, Card_Combat_zone, Card_Epidemic, Card_MeteorSwarm, Card_OpenSpace, Card_Pirates, Card_PlanetCard, Card_Slavers, Card_Smugglers, Card_Stardust
public abstract class Card extends Object implements Serializable
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • id

      protected int id
      The unique identifier for the card. This field stores the ID of the card which is used to uniquely distinguish between different card instances.

    • cardName

      protected String cardName
      The name of the card represented as a string. This field typically holds a unique or descriptive name for the card.

    • CardLevel

      protected int CardLevel
      Represents the level or rank of the card within the game. CardLevel is used to denote the card's hierarchy or progression level, which may influence its abilities, effects, or interactions with other game elements.

    • isTest

      protected boolean isTest
      Indicates whether the card is used for testing purposes. This variable is a flag to distinguish between test and non-test instances of the card.

    • state

      protected Card_State state
      Represents the current state of the card within the game lifecycle. The `state` variable denotes a `Card_State` object which encapsulates the current operational or contextual status of the card. This variable plays a crucial role in managing the behavior, transitions, and effects associated with the card during gameplay. This field is accessible to subclasses and other classes within the same package, and it is modifiable through appropriate setter methods. The state is an integral part of the card's logic, determining its interactions and the flow of associated game mechanics.

    • activated

      protected boolean activated
      Indicates whether the card is currently activated. This variable determines the active status of a card within the game. When set to true, the card is considered activated, enabling its functionality or effects.

    • State_enum

      protected c_State State_enum
      Represents the enumerated state associated with the card object. This field tracks the current state of the card using the c_State type, which can represent various phases or conditions of the card relevant to its functionality within the game.

    • game

      protected transient Game game
      Represents a game instance associated with the current card. This field holds the reference to the Game object, which contains the state and behavior of the game. It is marked as transient to exclude it from the default Java serialization process, as it may be managed or re-initialized separately upon deserialization. This variable provides access to game-specific properties and operations, enabling interaction between the card and the game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card()
      Constructs a new instance of the Card class. This is the default no-argument constructor for the Card class. It initializes a generic Card object without setting specific field values or states.

    • Card

      public Card(int id, String cardName, int cardLevel, boolean isTest)
      Constructor for the Card class that initializes the core attributes of a card.
      Parameters:
      id - An integer representing the unique identifier for the card.
      cardName - A string specifying the name of the card.
      cardLevel - An integer indicating the level of the card.
      isTest - A boolean flag indicating whether the card is used in a test or mock scenario.

  • Method Details

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      Retrieves the associated Game object for the current instance of the class.
      Returns:
      the Game object associated with the current instance

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the card.
      Returns:
      the unique identifier of the card as an integer

    • getCardName

      public String getCardName()
      Retrieves the name of the card.
      Returns:
      the card name as a String

    • getCrewLost

      public abstract int getCrewLost()
      Returns the number of crew members lost as a result of the card's effect.
      Returns:
      the number of crew members lost

    • getMoneyGained

      public abstract int getMoneyGained()
      Retrieves the amount of money gained from the current card.
      Returns:
      the amount of money gained as an integer

    • effect

      public void effect(FlightBoard board) throws Exception
      Applies the effect of the card on the provided flight board.
      Parameters:
      board - the flight board where the card's effect will be applied
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the execution of the effect

    • getFirePower

      public int getFirePower() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the firepower associated with this card.
      Returns:
      the firepower value as an integer
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is not supported or implemented

    • setActivation

      public void setActivation(boolean activated)
      Sets the activation state of the card.
      Parameters:
      activated - the new activation state to set. True indicates the card is activated, while false indicates it is deactivated.

    • getCardLevel

      public int getCardLevel()
      Retrieves the level of the card.
      Returns:
      the level of the card as an integer

    • isTest

      public boolean isTest()
      Determines if the card is marked as a test card.
      Returns:
      true if the card is a test card; false otherwise.

    • getDaysPenalty

      public int getDaysPenalty() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the number of days to be penalized by this card. The penalty is applied based on the game's current state and logic.
      Returns:
      the number of days to be penalized as an integer.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is not supported or an error occurs during execution.

    • getGoodsPenalty

      public int getGoodsPenalty() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the penalty value associated with goods in the current context. The method determines the penalty that will be applied depending on the game's state or card's behavior.
      Returns:
      the penalty value for goods as an integer
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is not implemented or an error occurs during the retrieval

    • getGoods

      public ArrayList<Goods> getGoods() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the list of goods associated with this card. This method is not supported and will always throw a RuntimeException.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Goods associated with this card
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - when the method is called, as it is not supported

    • getCrew

      public int getCrew() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the crew associated with the card.
      Returns:
      the number of crew for this card
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is not supported

    • viewMoneyEarning

      public int viewMoneyEarning() throws RuntimeException
      Provides the monetary earnings associated with the card.
      Returns:
      the amount of money earned by the card
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the operation is not supported

    • viewFlightPenalty

      public int viewFlightPenalty() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates or retrieves the penalty associated with a flight.
      Returns:
      the penalty value tied to the flight as an integer
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this method is not supported or implemented

    • viewCrewPenalty

      public int viewCrewPenalty() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the penalty related to the crew associated with the card. Throws a RuntimeException if the method is not supported or implemented in the context of the card.
      Returns:
      the integer value representing the crew penalty
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this operation is not supported

    • getPlanetVector

      public ArrayList<Planet> getPlanetVector()
      Retrieves a list of Planet objects relevant to the card's current state or functionality. The list may represent planets associated with the card under specific game mechanics or conditions.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Planet objects; the specific contents and conditions dictating the list will depend on the card's game logic.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is not supported in the current implementation.

    • getConsequences

      public ArrayList<Consequences> getConsequences()
      Retrieves the list of consequences associated with the current card. This may include various types of consequences, such as penalties or effects related to crew, goods, or other game elements.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing Consequences objects representing the consequences of the card
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is not supported

    • getCauses

      public ArrayList<Causes> getCauses()
      Retrieves a list of causes represented by the Causes objects.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Causes objects that represent the causes.

    • getState

      public Card_State getState()
      Retrieves the current state of the card.
      Returns:
      the current state of the card as a Card_State object

    • setStateENUM

      public void setStateENUM(ArrayList<Player> ps, c_State state) throws Exception
      Updates the card's state to the specified enumeration value and communicates the changes to clients. Triggers actions involving the specified players if applicable.
      Parameters:
      ps - the list of players involved in the state change
      state - the new state to be assigned to the card
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the state update or communication process

    • setStatENUMonly

      public void setStatENUMonly(c_State state)
      Updates the current card's state in the model without triggering any additional actions or notifications to clients or other entities.
      Parameters:
      state - the new state to set for the card.

    • setState

      public void setState(Card_State state) throws Exception
      Updates the state of the card to the specified state.
      Parameters:
      state - the new state to set for the card, represented by a Card_State object
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during state update

    • goNextState

      public void goNextState(FlightBoard flightBoard) throws Exception
      Proceeds the card to its next state based on the provided flight board. This involves updating the card's current state and potentially triggering any related actions or consequences specific to the new state.
      Parameters:
      flightBoard - The FlightBoard object used as context to determine the next state and handle state transition logic.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the state transition cannot be performed or encounters issues.

    • getShots

      public ArrayList<Shot> getShots()
      Retrieves the list of shots associated with the card. The returned shots represent specific actions or events defined within the context of the game. Each shot provides details such as its size, rotation, and type (e.g., Meteor or Cannon). This method allows external components or states to access and interact with these shots, enabling game mechanics that involve handling or processing these actions.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Shot objects representing the shots associated with the card.

    • getStateEnum

      public c_State getStateEnum()
      Retrieves the current state of the card as a state enumeration.
      Returns:
      the current state of the card represented as a c_State enumeration.

    • setGame

      public void setGame(Game game)
      Sets the current game instance.
      Parameters:
      game - the Game object to be assigned
